org.galiosten.calculator.parser

Class ExpressionParser

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.galiosten.calculator.parser.ExpressionParser

  • public class ExpressionParser
extends java.lang.Object
    The ExpressionParser is responsible for parsing the input provided by the user and generating a structure that can then be used to evaluate the expression.
    Author:
    rbets

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods

      static java.util.List<java.lang.String> getParameters(int expected, java.lang.String params)
      Returns a list of string parameters parsed from the provided parameter string.
      static Node parse(java.lang.String expression)
      Returns a parse tree generated by performing a recursive descent parse operation on the provided string expression.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Method Detail

      • parse

        public static Node parse(java.lang.String expression)
        Returns a parse tree generated by performing a recursive descent parse operation on the provided string expression. The resulting tree can then be evaluated using the Node.evaluate() method or visually inspected using the Node.getPrettyPrint() method.
        Parameters:
        expression - expression to parse
        Returns:
        a parse tree generated by performing a recursive descent parse operation on the provided string expression

      • getParameters

        public static java.util.List<java.lang.String> getParameters(int expected,
                                                             java.lang.String params)
        Returns a list of string parameters parsed from the provided parameter string. Parameters are delimited either by a ',' or end-of-string. Pattern-matching is used to extract parameters from provided string. Only parameters representing literal values, variables, or expressions are supported.
        Parameters:
        expected - the number of expected parameters.
        params - the string containing the unparsed parameters
        Returns:
        a list of string parameters parsed from the provided parameter string
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if an error occurs during parameter parsing
